title: This video is the new Single Ladies
text:
“YOU used to call me on my cell phone late-night when you need my love.” 
Drake’s video for the song Hotline Bling is breaking the internet. 
And it’s not because he is basically writing the rule book on the emotional minefield of hook-ups and feelings (oh and Drake has plenty of feelings). 
Nor is it because of his $1,050 Moncler jacket, Air Jordan tee, facial hair, Nicki Minaj-lookalike dancers and all-round Drizziness — it’s because of his dancing. 
The Canadian rapper is Beyonce and Hotline Bling is his Single Ladies moment . ‘I feel left out’ ... Drake gets emotional (of course) in the lyrics to his song, Hotline Bling. 
The clip is all about Drake’s dancing. His signature moves include pointing his fingers, sitting on a staircase and moving his shoulders, and at one point, semi-squatting while dragging his legs back and forth. 
He’s been called “goofy”, “daggy” and “dorky” but he’s just being Drake. Call me ... Drake appears to be mining making a phone call with his hands. 
If I saw a guy wearing a knitted skivvy dancing like this at the club, it would be a huge turn-off, unless that guy was Drake and that’s because Drake can get away with anything because he’s, well, Drake. HOTLINE BLING VIDEO 
His dancing has been compared to Carlton’s moves from The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air and Elaine’s from Seinfeld , spawning hilarious memes. PIZZA 
In one of the memes, Hotline Bling is replaced with Latin music, so it looks like Drake is dancing a poorly-choreographed salsa. 
Hotline Bling — which debuted on Apple Music — almost gave Drake his first No. 1 in the US (the song is currently No. 2 on the US Billboard chart behind The Weeknd’s The Hills ). The finger ... it’s doubtful Drake’s moves would work for anyone except Drake. 
If the Hotline Bling clip (by Director X) doesn’t win video of the year at the MTV VMAs, Kanye West should crash the stage like he did when Taylor Swift beat Beyonce’s Single Ladies . 
Since the song was released a few months ago, I’ve analysed the lyrics searching for answers to WTF boy-related questions in my life. 
It is rumoured that Drake, who has dated Rihanna and may be involved with Serena Williams right now, wrote the song about Instagram model, Nebby. Smooth ... here’s Drake making phone hands — again. All the single ladies ... one of Drake’s moves in the video for Hotline Bling. 
Maybe Drake broke up with a girl, she got over it, and he realised he still wanted her (boys, huh). 
“Ever since I left the city you got a reputation for yourself now. Everybody knows and I feel left out. Girl you got me down, you got me stressed out,” Drake raps. 
“Cause ever since I left the city, you started wearing less and goin’ out more ... Hangin’ with some girls I’ve never seen before.” 
Drake, can you call me on my cell phone? We need to talk. I feel like you’ll get it.
